div.sent: We earned our freedom in 1971 after nine months of Liberation War.
The Super Hero of that struggle for liberation is Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman.
He is also honoured as the Father of the Nation.
He was born on 17 March, 1920, in the village of Tungipara in Gopalganj district.
His father was Sheikh Lutfar Rahman and mother was Sayera Begum.
He passed the Secondary School Certificate Examination from Gopalganj Mission High School.
There he came in contact with many competent teachers.
After finishing school education, Sheikh Mujibur Rahman got himself admitted into Islamia College in Calcutta.
He became deeply involved in student politics.
He was jailed in 1948 for his involvement in the Language Movement.
He was elected later its General Secretary.
The infamous Agartala Conspiracy Case was started against him after he was arrested.
This resulted in serious reactions and agitations among the people of East Pakistan.
The movements for autonomy at one stage turned into People's revolution.
He was released from jail on February.
In 1970 General Election Awami Eeague got a huge majority vote from the people.
Everybody was sure that Sheikh Mujibur Rahman was going to be the President of Pakistan.
But unfortunately, a conspiracy was started not to allow Bangabandhu to form the Government.
The Pakistani rulers called off the Parliament session due to be held on 1 March.
Sheikh Mujib was arrested and sent to prison in West Pakistan.
The nation finally became free on 16 December, 1971.
Bangabandhu came back to independent Bangladesh after being released from prison in Pakistan.
The first ever Constitution of Bangladesh was also framed under his leadership.
This Constitution had four main policies: Democracy, Secularism, Socialism and Nationalism.
His contribution towards restructuring and development of the country during post-liberation period is unparalleled.
It enhanced the prestige of our mother tongue in the entire world.
